title: How to Make Ginger Garlic Tea

steps.title: Boil a pot of water.
steps.content: Boil a pot of water. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Slice the garlic and ginger into 1/8" slices.
steps.content: Slice the garlic and ginger into 1/8" slices. When you're done slicing you should have 1–1 1/2 tablespoons of garlic, and 2–3 tablespoons of ginger. Add to your cup. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pour a couple tablespoons of honey over the garlic and ginger.
steps.content: Pour a couple tablespoons of honey over the garlic and ginger. Add more if you prefer sweeter tea.

steps.title: Add a slice of lemon or lime, or some lemon or lime juice, to your cup.
steps.content: Add a slice of lemon or lime, or some lemon or lime juice, to your cup. This is optional, but does add a nice flavor. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pour the boiling water into your cup and let sit for a few minutes.
steps.content: Pour the boiling water into your cup and let sit for a few minutes. You don't have to worry about over-brewing the tea, but it will need to cool down before you drink it. If your throat is sore, now is a great time to position your head over the tea and inhale the steam. This will increase circulation to your throat and sinus, therefore helping to make them heal quicker.

steps.title: Enjoy your tea!
steps.content: Enjoy your tea! Have it up to three times a day for very sore throats, and reuse the sliced ginger and garlic up to three times before slicing more. [4] X Research source
